communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Tamisha Torres-Walker - BodyCam footage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Responding officer body camera footage of Tamisha Torres-Walker's October 3, 2021 encounter with APD. This incident is no longer under investigation.

To be clear, I am seeking body camera footage only.

If this is unable to be released, indicate which portions of the request are unable to be released, and the specific reason.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew

All emails, text messages and correspondence regarding the cancelation of Political Rewind with Bill Nigut and related programming changes at Georgia Public Broadcasting from May 1, 2023 to the present. This would include emails and text messages between employees and Commissioners (Brian Dill, Jerald Mitchell, Cecil Staton) of the Georgia Public Telecommunications Commission, also known as Georgia Public Broadcasting, employees of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (employees possessing email addresses that end in @ajc.com), Cox Media Group (@cmg.com or @coxmediagroup.com), and Cox Enterprises (@coxinc.com, @cox.com, and @coxenterprises.com), the Gov.'s office and any members of the state legislature including panelists on the show.
Also any correspondence with NPR, the NPR Board of Directors, NPR's Public Editor, and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting over the cancelation.

communications.subject: Public Records Request No. PIR 2023-1038
communications.communication:
You have submitted a request for the following public information from the City of Texas City:

"To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 1) A copy of any and all Open Records Request(s) received by the Texas City Police Department. 2) A copy of any and all Open Records Request(s) received by the City of Texas City, TX. 3) Date range: Between May 20, 2023 to June 23, 2023. "

The following is the request response from the City of Texas City:

Please find attached the documents that were responsive to your request.

The document provided contains redactions in accordance with Section 552.024 of the Texas Govt Code which allows us to withhold this specific information without requesting a ruling from the attorney general.
You have the right to appeal our decision to withhold this information from you. Instructions for appeal are at the end of this letter. If you do not want to appeal, you do not need to do anything else. Please note that we are only withholding the specific categories of information that are confidential under section 552.024. We have processed the rest of your request for information in accordance with the terms of the Public Information Act.
How to appeal the withholding of information under Gov’t Code section 552.136:
If you wish to appeal the withholding of information discussed on the previous page, you must send the following to the attorney general:
1) a signed, written statement indicating your wish to appeal the withholding of information;
2) the name of the governmental body that withheld information from you;
3) the date you made your original request for information; and
4) a copy of your original request for information, or if you are unable to provide a copy, a description of your original request for information.
You may also submit written comments stating why you think the information should be released to you, but you are not required to do so.
Send your appeal by mail to the attorney general at:
Open Records Division
P.O. Box 12548
Austin, Texas 78711-2548
Within forty-five business days after receiving all of the above-listed items necessary to file your appeal, the attorney general will issue a written ruling on the matter. You will receive a copy of this ruling in the mail.

City of Texas City
1801 9th Ave. N.
Texas City, Texas 77590

*Please do not reply to this email. You may email at cityhall@texascitytx.gov *

communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Security Contractors At LAUSD
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All LAUSD records which are Request For Proposal, Solicitations and corresponding contracts for Security and Defense Vendors/ Contractors.

I desire these records to better understand how it was in 2006 a student died at Venice Senior High and an investigation occured (According to several Press outlets) without the school premises being vacated or locked down at any stage during any attack that could have occured, or for the weeks following. 
Protocols regarding lockdown are apparent and whether or not they were followed should have been of keen interest to your Agency. 
If parents were not notified of the attack, or if students were allowed to investigate on campus in tandem with the press or other Agencies those Security tactics should be public knowledge. It should also be determined where responsibility was illegal or could have led to the attack itself. This information is of great value to all students and parents but also to those who seek budgetary constraints on certain forms of law enforcement.

These records of agreement, payment/exchange, bid, will serve as a directory and will provide means for third parties (person/organization/business/Agency) providing any form of security to LAUSD property to be rightfully contacted for questions and to release details pertaining to  educational communities historic protections, insurance, regulations regarding liaison with Law Enforcement Agencies, whether or not that occurred before-during-after the specific event referenced here, and all violent incidents prior/ those potentially occuring today.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri OAG Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

title: U. S. Mission to NATO Collaboration with Prominent Influencers

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: U. S. Mission to NATO Collaboration with Prominent Influencers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records detailing the efforts to "collaborate with prominent American influencers to co-create products about NATO’s role in global security" as described in the May 2023 report on the Inspection of the U.S. Mission to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. Records sought include a list of the "influencers" participated in this effort, any remuneration offered or given to the influencers, copies of the "products" that were "co-created" with the influencers, documentation of which Mission personnel took part in the initiative, and correspondence related to the planning, administration, and promotion of the initiative.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Tracey

title: Request for documents containing the name "Bruce Hume"

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Request for documents containing the name "Bruce Hume"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents/records referring to Bruce Hume (aka Bruce R. Hume, Bruce Huminski) or containing the name of Bruce Hume during the time period of 2010 - 2015. During this time period Bruce R. Hume was a resident of Wilton, Ct and employed by the Norwalk Police Department, Connecticut.

Detective Debra Hartin of the Gilbert P.D. had multiple interfaces and communications with the Wilton Ct. PD and the Surprise, AZ PD concerning Bruce Hume's harassment allegations concerning Scott Huminski in 2011-2013.  

At the time, Scott Huminski was a resident of Gilbert and Detective Hartin was communicating with police agencies about this matter. As such, the "Bruce Hume" documents and materials may also be located in a record search related to Justin M. Nelson (deceased) or Scott Huminski.

Here are the Wilton Connecticut reports on the Bruce Hume issue mentioned Detective Hartin of the Gilbert PD, Surprise Police and her status of being on the case. These documents are available to the public via Muckrock.

https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2017/01/19/1100010541.pdf

https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2017/01/19/1200009492.pdf

Bruce R. Hume, DOB 12/3/1956, resident Wilton CT, employed at Norwalk CT Police Dept. during the specified time period.

A record search for Wilton CT, Norwalk CT, Detective Debra Hartin or the Gilbert, AZ Police Department may yield the proper records with the additional search term of Bruce Hume.   

In 2013 Detective Debra Hartin informed Scott Huminski that Bruce Hume was on a campaign to terrorize, harass and financially harm Scott Huminski regarding an estate matter related to Theodore Huminski, thus Hume's communications were considered vexatious and in the pursuit of a vendetta against his brother, Scott Huminski, and the allegations were considered as completely without merit by all police agencies involved in Arizona, Connecticut and the FBI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

scott huminski

title: FOIA Frank Bomar Vietnam War OMPF

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Frank Bomar Vietnam War OMPF
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OMPF for Frank Bomar including cumulative record of training, history of assignments, military education, transfers and receipts, all military decorations and citations, personnel evaluations, unit awards, Bronze Star Medal citations, commendation medals, deployments South Vietnam.
1) History of Assignments NAVPERS form 601-5
2) Navy Occupational training history NAVPERS 601-4
3) Cumulative transfers and receipts NAVPERS 601-12, administrative remarks
4) Navy Commendation Medal citations
5) Silver Star Medal and Bronze Star Medal award citations
Awards include Bronze Star Medal with Combat V, Navy Commendation Medal with Combat V, Combat Action Ribbon, good conduct medal, Presidential Unit Citation, Navy Unit Commendation, Vietnam Campaign Medal. Service with SEAL TEAM ONE ST-1 Vietnam War 1967 to 1970, PRU Advisor Provincial Reconnaissance Unit, Phoenix Program CIA. Training includes UDTRA training, Basic Airborne School, SERE, Seal team advance training, 5326 Navy SEAL.

Please redact any sensitive information protected in accordance with the Privacy Act of 1974.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley

title: Requesting Details on Proposed Legislation (New York State Assembly)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Requesting Details on Proposed Legislation (New York State Assembly)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

RE: https://www.nysenate.gov/legislation/bills/2023/S1402

New York State Senate:

All documents, including but not limited to reports, research findings, statistical tabulations, and correspondence, that were reviewed or referenced during the drafting and review phase of proposed bill 2023-S1402. This includes any supporting information related to the justification, historical inequities, specific studies indicating increased student engagement, positive academic outcomes, and other relevant data.

New York State Assembly:

Similar to the request made to the New York State Senate, I request all documents, reports, research findings, statistical tabulations, and correspondence related to the drafting and review phase of proposed bill 2023-S1402. This encompasses the supporting information that justifies the statements made within the bill, including historical inequities, studies on increased student engagement, positive academic outcomes, and any other relevant data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sam Fife FBI Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI files on Sam Fife, a Navy veteran, and religious leader best known for his leadership role in a Christian sect sometimes referred to as "The Body of Christ," "The Body," "The Movement of God," "The Move," and "The End Times Ministry."  

Mr. Fife was killed in a plane crash in Guatemala on April 26, 1979, at the age of 54. 

His death was documented in Christianity Today: https://www.christianitytoday.com/ct/1979/june-29/protestant-sects-body-loses-its-earthly-head.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Michael Hill

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CISA IRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The CISA Incident Reporting System provides a secure web-enabled means of reporting computer security incidents to CISA ( OMB Control No.: 1670-0037 - https://us-cert.cisa.gov/forms/report). This system assists analysts in providing timely handling of security incidents as well as the ability to conduct improved analysis. I am requesting the records for every incident submitted to CISA through their Incident Reporting System submitted from January 1, 2020 until today’s date. These records should include but are not limited to an Incident ID, Incident Description, Date, Organizational Details ( including but not limited to a Name of Org ). 

Along with the above incident reports, I also am requesting any malware artifacts submitted to the Department of Homeland Security under the "US-CERT AMAC Malware Analysis Submissions" form ( https://www.malware.us-cert.gov/ ) since January 1 2020. These records should include any file submissions as well as the aforementioned form fields.

If possible, I would prefer that these records be provided in a machine-readable format such as a PDF, CSV or Excel file, and transferred electronically. If you cannot transfer the requested records electronically to my email, then please send them on a CD-ROM.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend.

Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: RE: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Shay Shelnutt VCCAP Communications
communications.communication:
Mr. Natta,

I am in receipt of your public records request (included below) for communications between Senator Shelnutt and several different organizations from January 1, 2020 to May 7, 2022.  This request was forwarded to me, as is common, to help ensure proper handling and compliance in accordance with Alabama law and legislative policy.
The Alabama Legislature and its agencies value transparency and public access to all of its official proceedings, as is set forth in Alabama’s Constitution.  Thus, we are always happy to either provide, or point out where to obtain public records for interested members of the public such as yourself.

In this particular case, however, your request does not include or identify any records or documents, if any such items even exist, that would be subject to our open records laws as the type of items requested would either not be public records containing any official legislative business, or would be subject to constitutional protections and confidentialities afforded to these types of documents and communications under the Speech and Debate clauses of the federal and Alabama constitutions.

Please feel free to reply back to me if you have any additional questions.

In case this is helpful to you in some way, please know that most all official legislative business can be found on the Alabama Legislature’s website: http://www.legislature.state.al.us<http://www.legislature.state.al.us/>.  For example, a list of each legislator’s filed bills may be found on the website as follows:  “Bills” >> “Bills by House Sponsor” and/or “Bills by Senate Sponsor” >> then click on the applicable legislator and a listing of his or her bills may be accessed, including any applicable votes or amendments, and the current disposition of the bill in the legislative process.

Again, please feel free to reach out to me with any additional questions or if I may be of further assistance.

Sincerely,


James L. Entrekin, Jr.
General Counsel
Legislative Services Agency
(334) 261-0696
www.lsa.state.al.us<http://www.lsa.state.al.us/>

[LSA Logo.png]

NOTICE OF CONFIDENTIALITY:  This electronic message, including attachments, is for the sole use of the named recipient and may contain confidential or privileged information pursuant to Section 29-6-7.1, Code of Alabama 1975.  Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, copying, or distribution is strictly prohibited.




Begin forwarded message:

files.source: Office Of Alabama Senator Shay Shelnutt, Alabama

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Request for documents containing the name "Bruce Hume"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents/records referring to Bruce Hume or containing the name of Bruce Hume during the time period of 2010 - 2015. During this time period Bruce R. Hume was a resident of Wilton, Ct and employed by the Norwalk Police Department.

Detective Debra Hartin of the Gilbert P.D. had multiple interfaces and communications with the Wilton Ct. PD and the Surprise, AZ PD concerning Bruce Hume's harassment allegations concerning Scott Huminski in 2011-2013.

At the time, I was a resident of Gilbert and Detective Hartin was communicating with police agencies about this matter.   As such, the "Bruce Hume" documents and materials may also be located in a record search related to Justin M. Nelson or Scott Huminski.

Here are the Wilton Connecticut reports on the Bruce Hume issue mentioned Detective Hartin of the Gilbert PD and her status of being on the case.  These documents are available to the public via Muckrock.

title: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request
communications.communication:
Dear Sir / Madam, 

I am writing to ask for your help with a request under the  Virginia State Open Records Law, Va Code sec §2.2-3700 - §2.2-3714.

Would it be possible for you to send me a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:

1.	A list of ALL types of alternative asset investments, including private equity, venture capital, distressed debt, mezzanine, fund of funds, infrastructure, natural resources, real estate and private debt partnerships in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and
2.	For each partnership, may I please have a copy of any alternative assets investment records that would show some or all of the following information:

a.	Richmond Retirement System's total commitment to the partnership,
b.	the total contributions made by Richmond Retirement System to the partnership to date,
c.	the total distributions received by Richmond Retirement System from the partnership to date,
d.	the estimated current value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in the partnership, and
e.	any available estimates of the Net and Gross IRR earned by Richmond Retirement System to date on its investment in the partnership.

3.	In addition to this could you please provide me with an up to date account of your current asset allocations in the above asset classes including any direct investments you may have.

Thank you very much for your attention to this request. In the event that Richmond Retirement System has no such investments, a simple note to this effect will suffice.  We understand that we may be charged for the cost of the copies requested, and agree to pay these charges. 

Please send the requested records via e-mail to foia@preqin.com

Thank you again for your attention to this request. 

Yours faithfully,

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Records of Facility Assessments Performed
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Per the CPS Facilities Condition Assessment page at https://www.cps.edu/services-and-supports/school-facilities/facility-condition-assessment 
"CPS is required to complete a comprehensive biennial condition assessment of each facility owned, leased, or operated by the district. CPS hires an independent firm to conduct the facility assessments. Assessment teams are made up of experienced building professionals including professional engineers, registered architects, and certified project managers."

Please provide records sufficient to show if and when these assessments have been performed since 2020, and if performed, at which schools. Please note that I am not requesting the contents of these assessments. I am requesting records documenting that they occurred. 

Requested information includes, but is not limited to: the schools assessed, the date(s) of assessment, and the firm(s) which performed them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Moser

communications.communication:

Re: Request for Public Records – RFPR No. P015635-062123 
Dear Rose, 
The County is in receipt of your Request for Public Records No. P015635-062123, dated 6/21/2023 11:05:02 AM, and received in this office on the same date, requesting: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office. 

The request documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
The County will need additional information to locate any records that may be responsive to your request. According to the Grant County Prosecutor's Office they need you to provide some clarification on your request. The Grant County Prosecutor's Office would like to know is you are requesting a list of Brady officers, or are you attempting to request a list and all of the material for each officer? 
Please be advised if the County does not hear from you within 30 days of the date of this email, this request will be deemed abandoned and will be closed. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact this office. Thank you for your courtesies. 
Sincerely, 
PUBLIC RECORDS OFFICE Grant County PO Box 37 Ephrata, WA 98823 NOTICE :  All emails, and attachments, sent to and from Grant County are public records and may be subject to disclosure pursuant to the Public Records Act (Chapter 42.56 RCW.
